tit.e: Chikusen-joirei (an ordinance to ordain a court rank to someone who saved a certain amount of money)

sen.j: 蓄銭叙位令（ちくせんじょいれい）は、和銅4年（711年）10月に、銭の流通を促進するためと、政府への環流を計って施行された法令。
sen.e: Chikusen-joirei was an ordinance which took effect in October 711 in order to promote circulation of money and attempt to circulation to the government.
"Chikusen-joirei" was an ordinance which took effect in October 711 in order to promote circulation of money and attempt to circulation to the government.
sen.cmt: Chikusen-jorei にダブルコーテーションを追記しました。
sen.e: "Chikusen-joirei" was an ordinance which took effect in October 711 in order to promote circulation of money and attempt to circulation to the government.

sen.j: 一定量の銭を蓄えた者に位階を与えた。
sen.e: Ikai (court rank) was given to a person who saved a certain amount of money.
Ikai (court rank) was given to a person who saved a certain amount of money.

sen.j: 早くも11月には叙位のあったことが記されている。
sen.e: It was described that joi (investiture of a court rank) was carried out as early as in November 711.
sen.cmt: 年号（711年）を補って訳しました。
sen.e: It was described that the conferment of a court rank was carried out as early as in November 711.
sen.cmt: joi (investiture of a court rank) を the conferment of a court rank に修正しました。
sen.e: It was described that the conferment of a court rank was carried out as early as in November 711.

sen.j: 後に、蓄銭が地方での銭の死蔵を招いたため、延暦19年（800年）に廃止された。
sen.e: Later, Chikusen-joirei was abolished in 800 because chikusen (savings) caused money to be hoarded up in the country.
Later, the ordinance was abolished in 800 because saving money caused dead storage in the country.

sen.j: 全6項から成り、位によって制限がある。
sen.e: Chikusen-joirei was composed of total fix articles and there were restrictions in accordance with ranks.

sen.j: また、位階の獲得を目的に他人から銭を借りることを禁じ、貸した者も処罰対象とされている。
sen.e: In addition, it was prohibited to borrow money from others with the aim of acquisition of ikai (court rank) and lenders were also subject to criminal punishment.
In addition, it was prohibited to borrow money from others with the aim of acquisition of court rank and lenders were also subject to criminal punishment.
sen.cmt: ikai (court rank) を court rank に修正しました。
sen.e: In addition, it was prohibited to borrow money from others with the aim of acquisition of court rank and lenders were also subject to criminal punishment.

sen.j: さらに、私鋳銭を製造しないよう、私鋳銭製造の罪に、大宝律の「徒三年」より厳しい「斬」（五刑の最高刑）が加えられている。
sen.e: Moreover, 'zan' (heaviest punishment among gokei (five punishments)), which was more severe than 'zu-sannen' (imprisonment of three years) of the Taiho Code, was added to punishments for manufacture of shichusen (counterfeit money) to prevent manufacture of shichusen.
sen.cmt: 「徒三年」は読み方不明ですが、徒罪（ずざい）・徒刑（ずけい）から、「ずさんねん」と推測して訳しました。

sen.j: ちなみに、銭1000文＝1貫と換算して、大初位までは5貫で一位。
sen.e: In this connection, if money was converted as 1000 mons (mon was a unit of currency) = 1 kan (kan was a unit of currency), a person with the rank up to Daishoi (Great Initial Rank) was given ichii (first rank) for 5 kans.
In this connection, converting 1000 mons (a unit of currency) to 1 kan, a person with the rank up to Daishoi (Great Initial Rank) was given ichii (first rank) for 5 kans.

sen.j: 従八位下から従六位以下までは10貫で一位、20貫で二位。
sen.e: A person with the rank from Juhachiinoge (Junior Eighth Rank, Lower Grade) to Jurokui (Junior Sixth Rank) was given ichii (first rank) for 10 kans, nii (second rank) for 20 kans.

sen.j: 正六位と五位以上は、臨時に勅を聴くこととされていた。
sen.e: A person with the rank of Shorokui (Senior Sixth Rank) and a person with the rank of Goi (Fifth Rank) or higher were supposed to temporarily hear an imperial edict.
